thread.title: Cleveland theater auditions for Oct. 2 and beyond: Karamu Performing Arts Theatre's "Black Nativity" by Langston Hughes & More
thread.title_full: Cleveland theater auditions for Oct. 2 and beyond: Karamu Performing Arts Theatre's "Black Nativity" by Langston Hughes & More | cleveland.com

author: Mark Rapp, The Plain Dealer
title: Cleveland theater auditions for Oct. 2 and beyond: Karamu Performing Arts Theatre's "Black Nativity" by Langston Hughes & More
text:
Audition list for Oct. 2 and beyond
82nd Street Theatre. Abundant Life Community Church, Royalton Business Park, 10143 Royalton Road (Ohio 82), Suite N & O, North Royalton. All roles available for students in grade 7 through college for "Scrooge! The Musical." 4:30-7 p.m. Sunday, Oct. 4 and 6-8:30 p.m. Monday, Oct. 5. Come prepared to sing a cappella 32 bars of a show tune or Disney type song, and wear comfortable clothes and shoes to learn a short dance step. Director: Tim Shamburger. Performances: Dec. 3-5. To fill out an online form, go to alcc.cc/82nd_Street_Theatre/Audition_Page/ .
Aurora Community Theatre. 115 E. Pioneer Trail, Aurora. Seeking a lighting designer for Tom Griffin's "The Boys Next Door" (Oct. 23-Nov. 14). Email Marc Howard at marc.howard@live.com .
Beachwood Community Theater. Seeking adults for ensemble roles in Emerald City and the Witch's guards in L. Frank Baum's "The Wizard of Oz" (Nov. 13-Dec. 6). Contact director Jill Koslen-Freireich at 216-595-3734.
Beachwood Community Theater. Beachwood Community Center, 25325 Fairmount Blvd., Beachwood. All roles available for men, women and children for "13, the Musical." Tuesday, Dec. 8 and Wednesday, Dec. 9 by appointment. Call Jill Koslen-Freireichat at 216-595-3734. Performances: May 7-22
Brecksville-Broadview Heights Community Band. Brecksville-Broadview Heights Middle School Band Room, 6376 Mill Road, Broadview Heights. Seeking musicians (flute/piccolo, oboe, clarinet, bassoon, Bb clarinet, bass clarinet, alto/tenor/baritone saxophones, trumpet/cornet, French horn, trombone, baritone/euphonium, tuba and percussion) for four concerts during the 2015-16 Season. Rehearsals: 7:30-9:15 p.m. every second and fourth Monday of the month during the school calendar year. Details: contact director Patty Nemitz at 440-442-8472 or 216-310-3795.
Broadview Heights Spotlights Community Theater. Broadview Heights Cultural Arts Building, 9543 Broadview Road. Seeking directors for the following productions: Christopher Durang's "Durang/Durang" (Jan. 29-Feb. 24); Pat Cook's "Barbecuing Hamlet" (April 22-May 7)' and Eric Bogosland's " Talk Radio" (Sept. 16-Oct. 1. Send a written statement specify shows of interest and why you are interested in working at Broadview Height Spotlights Community Theater and resume to president@broadview-heights-spotlights.org . Deadline: Sunday, Oct. 11. Include your availability for interview on Sunday, Oct. 25.
Chagrin Valley Choral Union. Our Redeemer Lutheran Church, 7196 SOM Center Road, Solon. Seeking new members for 2014-15 season. Rehearsals 7 p.m. Sundays. The choral union specializes in performing classical masterworks by Brahms, Haydn, Mozart, Bach, Rossini, Faure, Mendelssohn and Vivaldi. Details: go to chagrinvalleychoralunion.org and click on the membership link.
Chagrin Valley Little Theatre. 40 River St., Chagrin Falls. Seeking five women (two in their 50s and three in their 20 and a man age 29 or younger for Christopher Durang's "Vanya and Sonia and Masha and Spike." 7 p.m. Sunday and Monday, Oct. 18-19. Director: Bob McCoy. Performances: Jan. 15-Feb. 6. Details: go to cvlt.org. Seeking a choreographer for Monty Python's "Spamalot" (April 1-30). Paid position. Email Julia Wolff at wolff924@gmail.com.
Clague Playhouse. 1371 Clague Road, Westlake. Seeking a drummer for "Nuncrackers: The Nunsense Christmas Musical" (Nov. 13-Dec. 31). Paid stipend. Email Jayne Kacik at dinamaya@gmail.com . Seeking two men and two women for David Auburn's "Proof." 7:30 p.m. Tuesday and Wednesday, Oct. 20-21. Come prepared with a short monologue not to exceed two minutes and to read from the script. Director: Anne McEvoy. Performances: Jan. 15-Feb. 7. Perusal scripts available at the box office for a $10 refundable deposit. 1-6 p.m. Wednesday-Saturday. Details: call 440-331-0403.
Cleveland Philharmonic Orchestra. Opening for strings (violin, viola, cello), substitute brass and percussion for 2015-16 season. Rehearsals 7:30-10 p.m. Thursdays at Cuyahoga Community College's Metro Campus Auditorium, 2900 Community College Ave., Cleveland. For an appointment, contact personnel manager Lisa Wilson at 440-289-0818.
Convergence-Continuum. 2440 Scranton Rd, Cleveland. Seeking two African-American women, two African-American men and a Caucasian man ages 20-45 to play multiple roles for Robert O'Hara's "Bootycandy" (about growing up gay and black in America). 6 p.m. Wednesday, Oct. 14 and 11 a.m. Saturday, Oct. 17 by appointment. Email artistic director Clyde Simon at csimon@convergence-continuum.org . Come prepared with a monologue not to exceed three minutes to improvise. Performances: March 25-April 16.
Cuyahoga Falls Community Chorus. Summit Christian School, 2800 13 th St., Cuyahoga Falls. Seeking singers of all ages for 2015-16 season performing music from pop and show tunes to light classical and sacred works. Rehearsals: 7 p.m. Mondays. Details: go to cfchorus.com.
Ensemble Theatre. 2843 Washington Blvd., Cleveland Heights. Seeking three men and one woman for Charles Smith's "Golden Leaf Ragtime Blues" (director Ian Wolfgang Hinz; performances Feb. 5-28) and 11 men and five women for Jez Butterworth's "Jerusalem" (director Ian Wolfgang Hinz; performances April 29-May 22). 1-4:30 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 10 by appointment. Go to http://tiny.cc/ensemble-theatre.org to claim your audition slot or email auditions@ensemble-theatre.org and one will be assigned to you. Bring current resume and headshot. Details: go to ensembletheatrecle.org or call 216-321-2930.
EscapeCanton. Factory of Terror, 4125 Mahoning Road, Canton. Seeking two actors (one to play a zombie and the other an operator who oversees a game in which participates are locked in a giant puzzle room and have a time limit on figuring out how to escape). Paid position which can be short term or long term. ). To apply, go to https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1OfxiZUffEGtryaneYwxXh2hhYPQ6mvVAQQWwmj-pnz4/viewform?usp=send_form . Details: go to escapecanton.com.
Greater Cleveland Regional Transit Authority (RTA). Seeking musicians for the 2016 Transit Tracks music program in which musicians will perform from 3:30-6:30 p.m. on the third Thursday of each month. Paid position. For an application, go to riderta.com/news/sept-18-2015-musicians-needed-2016-transit-tracks-program. Email your application and three to five music files to artsintransit@gcrta.org or mail your application and non-returnable CD or DVD to Greater Cleveland Regional Transit Authority, 1240 West 6 th St., Cleveland, OH 44113 Attention Theresa Burrage. Questions: email artsintransit@gcrta.org .
GroundWorks DanceTheatre. Seeking a wardrobe coordinator to assist with costume management for 2015-16 season. Hourly rate paid commensurate with experience. Must have own transportation and be available days or evenings. Wardrobe and backstage experience preferred. Email general manager Beth Rutkowski with a list of your qualifications and contact information to info@groundworksdance.org .
Karamu Performing Arts Theatre. 2355 East 89 th St., Cleveland. Seeking singers and dancers ages 18 and older for Langston Hughes' "Black Nativity." Singers only: 7-9 p.m. Monday, Oct. 12. Singers and dancers: 7-9 p.m. Tuesday, Oct. 13. Come prepared with a contemporary gospel song of your choosing not to exceed one minute (accompanist provided and bring sheet music), you may be asked to sing a cappella. Dancers come dressed for movement. Bring head shot and resume. Director: Richard H. Morris Jr.; with musical director Glenn Brackens and choreographer Terrence Greene. Performances: Dec. 4-27. Details Richard H. Morris at 216-795-7070, ext. 236.
Lake Erie College/Rabbit Run Community Arts Association. Royce Hall for Fine and Performing Arts, 391 W. Washington St., Painesville. Seeking a man age 18-30 who can do a British accent for George Bernard Shaw's "Misalliance" (Nov. 13-22). Email director Jerry C. Jaffe at jjaffe@lec.edu for an appointment.
Lakeland Civic Theatre. Lakeland Community College's Performing Arts Center, Building D, 7700 Clocktower Drive, Kirtland. All roles available for men and women for Stephen Sondheim and James Lapine's "Into the Woods." 7-10 p.m. Sunday and Monday, Oct. 25 and 26. Come prepared with two contrasting Sondheim pieces, each 16-32 bars. There is the possibility of one Equity contract for this production. Director: Martin Friedman; with music director Jordan Cooper. Performances: Jan. 29-Feb.21. Details: email the director at martinfriedman98@gmail.com .
Legacy Singers. St. Thomas Episcopal Church, 50 E. Bagley Road, Berea. Seeking adults, teens and children for 2015-16 season. 7 p.m. Tuesday, Sept. 15. Director: David Wallace. Details: call executive director Ann Marie Irwin at 440-846-0973 or email amilegacy@roadrunner.com .
Magical Theatre Company. 565 W. Tuscarawas Ave., Barberton. Seeking an actress age 18-30 for the role of Cinderella in "Cinderella." Rehearsals begin Nov. 9 with performances Dec. 2-20. Daytime availability is required for student matinees. Paid position. Email picture and resume to magicaltheatre@aol.com . Details: go to magicaltheatre.org.
Mercury Theatre. Notre Dame College's Regina Auditorium, 1851 S. Green Road, South Euclid. Seeking musical directors for 2016 season. Must have a history of collaborative work with directors, choreographers and production teams, familiarity with musical cannon, and a commitment to arts education as well as organization, management and communication skills. Paid positions. Send resume and cover letter to artistic director Pierre Brault at pierre@mercurytheatrecompany.org .
Moscow Ballet. Cuyahoga Falls Dance Center, 428 Portage Trail, Cuyahoga Falls. Seeking dance students ages 7-16 to perform as Party Children, Mice, Snowflakes, Angels and other roles with Russian dancers in "Great Russian Nutcracker." 2 p.m. Sunday, Oct. 4. Come dress in dance attire with Pointe shoes, and must have at least one year of ballet training. Performances: Monday and Tuesday, Dec. 14-15 at Cleveland Music Hall. To register, go to nutcracker.com/youth-auditions/sign-up-to-audition. Addition information available at Cuyahoga Falls Dance Center, 330-801-1475.
Mr. Kringle & Company. Level One inside Tower City Center, 230 W. Huron Road, Cleveland. Seeking men and women ages 18 and over for Kringle's Inventionasim, a 60-minute interactive theatrical experience where guests tour different departments, explore each area and engage in hands-on activities to help Kringle, his family, friends and fellow inventors to prepared for the holiday season. Auditions: 2-5 p.m. Saturday and Sunday, Oct. 10-11 and 6-9 p.m. Monday, Oct. 12 by appointment. Email jobs@mrkringle.com with the date you'll be attending as well as your phone number. Preview performances: 6-8 p.m. Nov. 14-18. Full production: Nov. 20-Dec. 24. Full and part-time schedules available. For a complete list of roles and character descriptions, go to www.mrkringle.com/blogs/news/53391557-employment-opportunity. Paid positions. Details: email director Miron Gusso at mirongusso@gmail.com .
Near West Theatre. Gordon Square Art District, 6702 Detroit Ave., Cleveland. Accepting resumes and materials from experienced set designers for "Godspell." Pre-production begins immediately, rehearsals begin Jan. 3, tech starts Feb. 8 and the show opens Feb. 12. Email production manager T. Paul Lowry at tlowry@nearwesttheatre.org .
North Canton Playhouse Youth Theatre. 525 7 th St., North Canton. Seeking students ages 7-19 for "Elf, the Musical Jr.!" 1 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 3. Director: Lisa Paynter. Performances: Dec. 4-20. For audition requirements and preparation, go to northcantonplayhouse.com.
Northwest High School. 8580 Erie Ave., Canal Fulton. Seeking a set designer/master carpenter for a winter musical (Feb. 26-28). Duties include collaborating with directors on show concept, designing the set, constructing some props and purchasing and transporting materials, directing the set construction, collaborating with the set paint crew lead and supervising the strike. Email Leslie Haynam at haynam.l@northwest.sparcc.org .
Ohio City Theatre Project. The Idea Center at Playhouse Square. Entrance is 1375 Dodge Court (an alley south of Chester Avenue and the Playhouse Square Parking Garage). All roles available for men and women for Pandora Robertson's "Incendiaries" (Jan. 7-23) and "Code Breakers" (May 2-15). 6:30 p.m. or 8 p.m. Mondays, Oct. 12 and 19 in 75-minute slots. Email director Pandora Robertson at Pandora@ohiocitytheatreproject.com . Bring two copies of your resume and headshot, dress comfortably for movement and bring a prepared monolog. No AEA contracts, but there is a paid stipend for both project. Details: go to ohiocitytheatreproject.com/site/.
Ohio Dance Theatre. The Dancers' Studio at Oberlin, 39 S. Main St., Oberlin. Seeking youth dancers for "The Nutcracker." Saturday, Oct. 3: advanced dancers ages 13-18 at 3:30 p.m.; intermediate dancers ages 9-12 at 4:30 p.m. Ages 7-8: 3:30 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 17. Arrive 15 minutes early to check in and advanced dancers should bring pointe shoes. Performances: Dec. 18-20 at Lorain County Community College's Stocker Arts Center. Details: call 440-774-6077 or go to thedancersstudioatoberlin.org or ohiodancetheatre.org.
Olde Towne Hall Youth Theatre. 36119 Center Ridge Road, North Ridgeville. All roles available for youth ages 6-18 for "Shrek, the Musical." 2-4 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 10. Come prepared with a song and dress for movement. Director: Sharon Godsey. Performances: Dec. 4-12. Details: call 440-327-2909 or email oldetownehall@gmail.com .
Pickwick & Frolic. 2035 East 4 th St., Cleveland. Seeking a male singer/host for "Vegas Burlesque." 7-8:30 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 15 9 by appointment. Email director Michael Rogaliner at rogalinerm@sbcglobal.net . Audition with "Viva Las Vegas" (background track provided) and a song that is suitable in a Vegas Revue (bring a CDE track or sing a cappella). Paid positions. Show is currently running with one performance most weekends on Friday night.
Theater Ninjas. The Idea Center at Playhouse Square. Entrance is 1375 Dodge Court (an alley south of Chester Avenue and the Playhouse Square Parking Garage). All roles available for men and women for Jeremy Paul's "Who We Used to Be" (Feb. 24-28) and "Broke Codes" (created by multiple artist-creators with performances May 2-22). 6:30 p.m. or 8 p.m. Mondays, Oct. 12 and 19 in 75-minute slots. Bring two copies of your resume and headshot, dress comfortably for movement and bring a prepared monolog. No AEA contracts, but there is a paid stipend for both project. Details: email rlucas@theaterninjas.com .
TrueNorth Cultural Arts. Lorain County Metroparks' French Creek Nature and Arts Center, 4530 Colorado Ave., Sheffield. All roles available for men and women for Neil Simon's "The Odd Couple." 6-8 p.m. Tuesday and Wednesday, Oct. 6-7. Director: Greg Violand. Performances: Jan. 15-31. All roles available for men and women for Tom Kitt and Brian Yorkey's "Next to Normal." 10:30 a.m.-2:30 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 17 and 7-10 p.m. Sunday, Oct. 18 in 10-minute increments by appointment. Walk-in will be accepted as time permits. Come prepared with a one-minute musical theater song and a one-minute contemporary monologue that's character and objective driven. Selections from "Next to Normal" are acceptable. Non-Equity actors will receive a stipend for this production. Director: Fred Sternfeld. Performances: May 6-22. Details for either productions, call 440-949-5200, ext. 221 or go to tncarts.org. Seeking two actors ages 18 and up for the roles of Oberon and Titania in the Family Life Series' production of William Shakespeare's " A Midsummer Night's Dream" (Nov. 6-15). For an appointment, email director Brian McNally at bmcnally@tncarts.org or call 440-949-5200, est. 226.
Weathervane Playhouse. 1301 Weathervane Lane, Akron. All roles available for the following productions. For an appointment/production details, go to weathervaneplayhouse.com/audition. Bruce Norris's "Clybourne Park." 6-9 p.m. Sunday, Nov. 1 and 7-9 p.m. Monday, Nov. 2. Performances: Jan. 14-31. George S. Kaufman and Moss Hart's "The Man Who Came to Dinner." 6-9 p.m. Sunday, Nov. 8 and 7-9 p.m. Monday, Nov. 9. Performances: March 17-April 3. Nicky Silver's "The Lyons." 7-9 p.m. Sunday and Monday, Nov. 22-23. Performances: Feb. 4-16. Rick Elice's "Peter and the Starcatcher." 5-8 p.m. Sunday and Monday, Jan. 3-4. Performances: Feb. 25-March 6.
